abstract.p: A process for producing hydrogen comprising subjecting a gaseous mixture 48 of a hydrocarbon and steam, with a steam to carbon ratio of at least 2.6:1, to steam reforming in a gas-heated reformer 52, followed by autothermal reforming 56 to generate a reformed gas mixture 66. One or more water-gas shift stages 74 increase the hydrogen content of the reformed mixture. The hydrogen-enriched gas 82 is cooled and condensed water separated prior to passing through a carbon dioxide separation unit 128 to produce a CO2 stream 130 and a crude hydrogen stream 132. The crude hydrogen stream is passed to a purification unit 134 to produce a purified hydrogen gas 136 and a fuel gas 142. The fuel gas is fed, as the sole fuel, to fired heaters 16, 144 to heat process streams. By using the fuel gas as the sole fuel source, CO2 emissions may be minimised.
